main event: Two unidentified aerial objects were sighted by five people, including the Russell Field Airport manager and a U.S. Weather Observer, in Rome, Georgia on November 14, 1950.
interesting points: The objects were described as 'flying saucers' or 'strange discs'.
The objects were in sight for several minutes before disappearing, one to the north and one to the northeast.
One of the objects dropped toward the field and then climbed away.
The altitude and size of the objects were impossible to estimate.
An Air Force ATC training plane 'buzzed' the Russell Field runway at the same time the objects were sighted.
sighted object: two unidentified aerial objects described as 'flying saucers' or 'strange discs'
witnesses: five people, including the Russell Field Airport manager and a U.S. Weather Observer
